content.text: Find the area of the Valdivian rainforest as a percentage of the area of the Amazon rainforest
Write, in its simplest form, the ratio of the areas of the rainforests Valdivian : Atlantic : Congo
The Amazon rainforest has \(60\%\) of its area in Brazil and \(10\%\) of its area in Colombia
43 \(\frac{1}{3}\%\) of the **remaining area** of the rainforest is in Peru
Find the percentage of the Amazon rainforest that is in Brazil, Colombia and Peru
The area of the Amazon rainforest represents \(\frac{27}{50}\) of the total area of rainforest in the world
Calculate the total area of rainforest in the world
Give your answer correct to the nearest \(100000\mathrm{km}^2\)
In the world, 60.7 hectares of rainforest are lost every minute
Calculate the total area, in hectares, of rainforest that is lost in 365 days
Give your answer in standard form
.........  hectares
The table shows the areas, in \(\text{km}^2\), of the four largest rainforests in the world
The Amazon river has a length of \(6440\mathrm{km}\), correct to the nearest \(10\mathrm{km}\)
The Congo river has a length of \(4400\mathrm{km}\), correct to the nearest \(100\mathrm{km}\)
Calculate the upper bound of the difference between the lengths of the Amazon river and the Congo river
triangle \(T\) after a reflection in the \(x\)-axis
triangle \(T\) after a translation by the vector \(\begin{pmatrix} - 5 \\ - 2 \end{pmatrix}\)
triangle \(T\) after an enlargement by scale factor \(- \frac{1}{2}\) with centre \(\left(- 1, 1\right)\)
On the grid, draw the image of
A shape \(P\) is enlarged by scale factor 3 to give shape \(Q\)
Shape \(Q\) is then enlarged by scale factor \(\frac{2}{5}\) to give shape \(R\)
The area of shape \(P\) is \(10 \mathrm{cm}^2\)
Calculate the area of shape \(R\)
Find \(C\) when \(x = 5\) and \(y = 8\)
Find the positive value of \(y\) when \(C = 15\) and \(x = 2.4\)
Write as a single fraction in its simplest form
Expand and simplify
Simplify
Find the median time
Find the interquartile range
Find the difference between the average speed of the fastest car and the average speed of the slowest car
Give your answer in kilometres per hour
Jianyu records the time, in seconds, that some cars take to travel 195 m
The box and whisker plot shows this information
Write down the class interval that contains the median
Calculate an estimate of the mean
A histogram is drawn to show the information in the table
The height of the bar for the interval \(250 < d \leqslant 300\) is \(2.8 \text{cm}\)
Calculate the height of the bar for each of the following intervals
Two of the 80 cars are chosen at random
Find the probability that, with a full tank of fuel, one of the cars can travel more than \(450\mathrm{km}\) and the other car can travel not more than \(300\mathrm{km}\)
Matilda records the distances that 80 different cars can travel with a full tank of fuel
The table shows this information

content.text: Find \(\overrightarrow{PQ}\)
\(\overrightarrow{PQ} = \left( \begin{array}{c} \\ \\ \end{array} \right)\)
Show that \(\left|\overrightarrow{OP}\right| = \left|\overrightarrow{OQ}\right|\)
\(PQ\) is a chord of a circle with centre \(O\)
Calculate the circumference of this circle
\(PQ\) is the diameter of a different circle with centre \(R\)
Find the coordinates of \(R\)
Find the equation of the perpendicular bisector of \(PQ\)
Give your answer in the form \(y = mx + c\)
\(P\) is the point (1, 7)
\(Q\) is the point (5, \(-5\) )
The position vector of \(A\) is \(\mathbf{a}\)
The position vector of \(B\) is \(\mathbf{b}\)
\(M\) is a point on \(AB\) such that \(AM:MB = 2:3\)
Find, in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{b}\), the position vector of \(M\)
Give your answer in its simplest form
Find the bearing of the harbour from boat \(C\)
Show that angle \(CBH = 100^\circ\)
Show that \(BH = 13.7 \text{km}\), correct to 1 decimal place
Calculate the bearing of \(A\) from \(B\)
Calculate the time when boat \(C\) arrives at the harbour
Give this time correct to the nearest minute
[1 knot = 1.852 km/h]
Calculate the distance of boat \(C\) to the harbour when boat \(C\) is at the shortest distance from lighthouse \(B\)
At \(1\mathrm{pm}\) boat \(C\) sails \(32\mathrm{km}\) directly to the harbour at a speed of 10 knots
The diagram shows the positions of two lighthouses \(A\) and \(B\), a boat \(C\) and a harbour \(H\). \(C\) is due east of \(B\)
Work out the surface area of the inside of the open box
Cylinders with height \(20\mathrm{cm}\) and diameter \(15\mathrm{cm}\) are placed in the box
Work out the maximum number of these cylinders that can completely fit inside the box
The diagram shows a box in the shape of a cuboid
The box is open at the top
Show that the radius of the cone is \(2.99 \mathrm{~cm}\), correct to 3 significant figures
[Density = mass \(\div\) volume]
[The volume, \(V\) , of a cone with radius \(r\) and height \(h\) is \(V = \frac{1}{3}\pi r^2 h\).]
Calculate the total surface area of the cone
[The curved surface area, \(A\), of a cone with radius \(r\) and slant height \(l\) is \(A = \pi r l\).]
A solid bronze cone has a mass \(750 \mathrm{~g}\)
The density of the bronze is \(8.9 \mathrm{~g} / \mathrm{cm}^3\)
The ratio radius of cone : height of cone \(= 1:3\)
On the axes, sketch the graph of \(y = x^{2} + 7x - 18.\)
On your sketch, write the values where the graph meets the \(x\)-axis and the \(y\)-axis
Find the derivative of \(y = x^{2} - 3x - 28.\)
Find the coordinates of the turning point of \(y = x^{2} - 3x - 28.\)
The line \(y = 5 - 2x\) intersects the graph of \(y = x^{2} - 3x - 28\) at point \(P\) and point \(Q\)
Find the coordinates of \(P\) and \(Q\)
You must show all your working and give your answers correct to 2 decimal places
